question: How many of Jesus' brothers are named in the Bible?
explanation: Jesus' brothers were James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas (not Iscariot).

verses.kjv: Is not this the carpenterâ€™s son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas?

question: What other name was Bartholomew known by?
explanation: Bartholomew is believed to be the same person as Nathanael, whom Philip brought to Jesus.

verses.kjv: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.

question: Where was Paul when he had a vision of a man from Macedonia?
explanation: During the night Paul had a vision of a man of Macedonia standing and begging him to come help them.

verses.kjv: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night; There stood a man of Macedonia, and prayed him, saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.

question: How many apostles wrote books of the New Testament?
explanation: Matthew, John, Peter, James, and Jude (if counted) wrote New Testament books.

verses.kjv: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

question: Which apostle was called 'the Zealot'?
explanation: Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zealot.

verses.kjv:
Matthew and Thomas, James the
son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,

question: Which apostle was chosen to replace Judas Iscariot?
explanation: The apostles cast lots between Matthias and Justus, and Matthias was chosen to replace Judas.

verses.kjv: And they gave forth their lots; and the lot fell upon Matthias; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

question: Which apostle walked with Jesus on the road to Emmaus without recognizing him?
explanation: Cleopas and another disciple walked with Jesus to Emmaus, but their eyes were kept from recognizing him.

verses.kjv: And the one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which are come to pass there in these days?

question: Who accompanied Paul to Athens?
explanation: Silas and Timothy stayed in Berea while Paul went to Athens, then joined him later.

verses.kjv:
And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea: but Silas and Timotheus abode there still.
And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed, they departed.

question: How many years did Paul spend in Arabia after his conversion?
explanation: Three years later Paul went up to Jerusalem to get acquainted with Peter.

verses.kjv: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.

question: Which apostle was a zealot?
explanation: Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zealot.

verses.kjv:
Matthew and Thomas, James the
son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,

question: What was Bartholomew's other name?
explanation: Philip found Nathanael and told him, 'We have found the one Moses wrote about in the Law.'

verses.kjv: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.

question: Which apostle is called 'the Lesser'?
explanation: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joseph, and Salome.

verses.kjv: There were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

question: Which apostle questioned how they could afford to feed 5,000 people?
explanation: Philip answered him, 'It would take more than half a year's wages to buy enough bread for each one to have a bite!'

verses.kjv: Philip answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.

question: What was Matthew also called?
explanation: As he walked along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector's booth.

verses.kjv:
And as he passed by, he saw Levi the
son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him,
Follow me. And he arose and followed him.

question: Which apostle was known as Didymus?
explanation: Then Thomas (also known as Didymus) said to the rest of the disciples, 'Let us also go, that we may die with him.'

verses.kjv: Then said Thomas, which is called Didymus, unto his fellowdisciples, Let us also go, that we may die with him.

question: Which apostle brought Greeks to see Jesus?
explanation: They came to Philip with a request. 'Sir,' they said, 'we would like to see Jesus.' Philip went to tell Andrew; Andrew and Philip in turn told Jesus.

verses.kjv:
The same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.
Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.

question: Which apostle asked Jesus to show them the Father?
explanation: Philip said, 'Lord, show us the Father and that will be enough for us.'

verses.kjv: Philip saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.

question: Which apostle was also called Didymus?
explanation: Now Thomas (also known as Didymus), one of the Twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came.

verses.kjv: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

question: Which apostle was from Bethsaida, the same town as Peter and Andrew?
explanation: Philip, like Andrew and Peter, was from the town of Bethsaida.

verses.kjv: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
